bibl.title: Lee Fong v. John Sullivan. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: United States District Court for the District of Washington

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Lee Fong for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
div1.ab: No. 2333. Order. Certifying to United States Circuit Court.
div1.p: This cause coming on this fifty (5th) day of September, 1902, for hearing of rule granted to show cause why a writ of Habeas Corpus should not be issued as prayed for in the Petition herein, and it appearing to the Court that ordinance 710 of the City of Seattle, the constitutionality of which is directly involved in the contention herein, was prepared by the Judge of the above entitled court whilst he was the City Attorney for the City of Seattle, by reason whereof he is disqualified from passing upon and determining impartially the issue involved herein;

Now, therefore, it is hereby ordered and adjudged that the hearing of the Rule to show cause, and all further proceedings herein, be, and they are hereby certified to the United States Circuit Court for the 9th Circuit for hearing thereof.
Filed in the U.S.District court, Dist of Washington Sep 5 1902 R.M.HOPKINS, Clerk, H.M.Walthew,Deputy.
